poem:
Title: 'Resilience, Rising'

Ringing alarm, echoes on a stranger's shore,
Unease weaving in the warp of smiles.
In the twining narrative of unwanted touch,
Silence, broken by courage undeterred;
A quiet roar, its echo reshaping the world.
How, like the Amazons of ancient lore,
They uphold dignity, even amidst the vile.
Their stand against night, a new dawn unfurled.
